meanings.definition: An introduction to a book or other literary work.
meanings.sent1: The author wrote a preface to explain the inspiration behind the story.
meanings.sent2: I always read the preface of a book to understand the author's perspective.
meanings.sent3: The preface of the novel was so funny that it made me laugh out loud.
meanings.sent4: Her preface to the play set the stage for an emotional rollercoaster.
meanings.sent5: The preface painted a vivid picture of the world within the book.

meanings.definition: To introduce or begin with a preface.
meanings.sent1: Let me preface my speech with a few words of gratitude.
meanings.sent2: She always likes to preface her stories with a brief explanation.
meanings.sent3: He decided to preface his joke with a funny anecdote.
meanings.sent4: The speaker will preface the event with an exciting announcement.
meanings.sent5: To preface the meeting, she shared a heartwarming story.

meanings.sent1: The scientist provided a preface to clarify the purpose of the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The preface of the report outlined the key findings.
meanings.sent3: His preface to the project was so detailed that it answered all our questions.
meanings.sent4: The preface of the speech captured everyone's attention from the start.
meanings.sent5: In the preface, she highlighted the main points to be discussed.
